newsitem.title: USA: Reinsurance Group could boost dividend.
newsitem.headline: Reinsurance Group could boost dividend.

text.p: Reinsurance Group of America Inc said Thursday it was in a position to boost its dividend this year.
Earlier Reinsurance Group said it earned $15.1 million, or $0.88 a share, in the second quarter versus $13.5 million, or $0.79 a share, in the same period last year.

"The company's consolidated earnings were generally in line with our operating plan, as were policy lapses and allowance levels," said A. Greig Woodring, president and chief executive, in a statement.

"Quote activity and other business opportunities continue at strong levels, and we remain optimistic regarding our ongoing growth prospects. As a result, we are in a position to increase our dividend for the third year in a row," he added.
